name: gitlens
description: Supercharge the Git capabilities built into Visual Studio Code — Visualize code authorship at a glance via Git blame annotations and code lens, seamlessly navigate and explore Git repositories, gain valuable insights via powerful comparison commands, and so much more

gitlens.blame.avatars.description: Specifies whether to show avatar images in the gutter blame annotations

gitlens.blame.compact.description: Specifies whether to compact (deduplicate) matching adjacent gutter blame annotations

gitlens.blame.dateFormat.description:
Specifies how to format absolute dates (using the `${date}` token) in gutter blame annotations
See https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/ for valid formats

gitlens.blame.format.description:
Specifies the format of the gutter blame annotations
Available tokens
 ${id} - commit id
 ${author} - commit author
 ${message} - commit message
 ${ago} - relative commit date (e.g. 1 day ago)
 ${date} - formatted commit date (format specified by `gitlens.blame.dateFormat`)
 ${agoOrDate} - commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
 ${authorAgo} - commit author, relative commit date
 ${authorAgoOrDate} - commit author, commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
See https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/wiki/Advanced-Formatting for advanced formatting

gitlens.blame.heatmap.enabled.description: Specifies whether to provide a heatmap indicator in the gutter blame annotations

enumDescriptions: Adds a heatmap indicator on the left edge of the gutter blame annotations
Adds a heatmap indicator on the right edge of the gutter blame annotations
gitlens.blame.heatmap.location.description: Specifies where the heatmap indicators will be shown in the gutter blame annotations

gitlens.blame.highlight.enabled.description: Specifies whether to highlight lines associated with the current line

enumDescriptions: Adds a gutter glyph
Adds a full-line highlight background color
Adds a decoration to the overview ruler (scroll bar)

gitlens.blame.highlight.locations.description: Specifies where the associated line highlights will be shown

gitlens.blame.ignoreWhitespace.description: Specifies whether to ignore whitespace when comparing revisions during blame operations

gitlens.blame.separateLines.description: Specifies whether gutter blame annotations will be separated by a small gap

enumDescriptions: Toggles each file individually
Toggles the window, i.e. all files at once
gitlens.blame.toggleMode.description: Specifies how the gutter blame annotations will be toggled

enumDescriptions: Toggles file blame annotations
Compares the current committed file with the previous commit
Shows a commit details quick pick
Shows a commit file details quick pick
Shows a file history quick pick
Shows a branch history quick pick
gitlens.codeLens.authors.command.description: Specifies the command to be executed when the `authors` code lens is clicked

gitlens.codeLens.authors.enabled.description: Specifies whether to provide an `authors` code lens, showing number of authors of the file or code block and the most prominent author (if there is more than one)

gitlens.codeLens.enabled.description:
Specifies whether to provide any Git code lens, by default
Use the `Toggle Git Code Lens` command (`gitlens.toggleCodeLens`) to toggle the Git code lens on and off for the current window

gitlens.codeLens.includeSingleLineSymbol.description: Specifies whether to provide any Git code lens on symbols that span only a single line

enumDescriptions: Toggles file blame annotations
Compares the current committed file with the previous commit
Shows a commit details quick pick
Shows a commit file details quick pick
Shows a file history quick pick
Shows a branch history quick pick
gitlens.codeLens.recentChange.command.description: Specifies the command to be executed when the `recent change` code lens is clicked

gitlens.codeLens.recentChange.enabled.description: Specifies whether to provide a `recent change` code lens, showing the author and date of the most recent commit for the file or code block

enumDescriptions: Adds code lens at the top of the document
Adds code lens at the start of container-like symbols (modules, classes, interfaces, etc)
Adds code lens at the start of block-like symbols (functions, methods, etc) lines

gitlens.codeLens.scopes.description: Specifies where Git code lens will be shown in the document

language.description: Specifies the language to which this code lens override applies

enumDescriptions: Adds code lens at the top of the document
Adds code lens at the start of container-like symbols (modules, classes, interfaces, etc)
Adds code lens at the start of block-like symbols (functions, methods, properties, etc) lines
Adds code lens at the start of symbols contained in `symbolScopes`

scopes.description: Specifies where Git code lens will be shown in the document for the specified language

symbolScopes.description:
Specifies the set of document symbols where Git code lens will be shown in the document for the specified language
Must be a member of `SymbolKind`

gitlens.codeLens.scopesByLanguage.description: Specifies where Git code lens will be shown in the document for the specified languages

gitlens.codeLens.symbolScopes.description:
Specifies a set of document symbols where Git code lens will or will not be shown in the document
Prefix with `!` to avoid providing a Git code lens for the symbol
Must be a member of `SymbolKind`

gitlens.currentLine.dateFormat.description:
Specifies how to format absolute dates (using the `${date}` token) for the current line blame annotation
See https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/ for valid formats

gitlens.currentLine.enabled.description:
Specifies whether to provide a blame annotation for the current line, by default
Use the `Toggle Line Blame Annotations` command (`gitlens.toggleLineBlame`) to toggle the annotations on and off for the current window

gitlens.currentLine.format.description:
Specifies the format of the current line blame annotation
Available tokens
 ${id} - commit id
 ${author} - commit author
 ${message} - commit message
 ${ago} - relative commit date (e.g. 1 day ago)
 ${date} - formatted commit date (format specified by `gitlens.currentLine.dateFormat`)
 ${agoOrDate} - commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
 ${authorAgo} - commit author, relative commit date
 ${authorAgoOrDate} - commit author, commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
See https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/wiki/Advanced-Formatting for advanced formatting

gitlens.currentLine.scrollable.description: Specifies whether the current line blame annotation can be scrolled into view when it is outside the viewport

gitlens.defaultDateFormat.description:
Specifies how absolute dates will be formatted by default
See https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/ for valid formats

enumDescriptions: e.g. 1 day ago
e.g. July 25th, 2018 7:18pm
gitlens.defaultDateStyle.description: Specifies how dates will be displayed by default

enumDescriptions: A geometric pattern
A simple, cartoon-style silhouetted outline of a person (does not vary by email hash)
A monster with different colors, faces, etc
8-bit arcade-style pixelated faces
A robot with different colors, faces, etc
A face with differing features and backgrounds
gitlens.defaultGravatarsStyle.description: Specifies the style of the gravatar default (fallback) images

gitlens.heatmap.ageThreshold.description: Specifies the age of the most recent change (in days) after which the gutter heatmap annotations will be cold rather than hot (i.e. will use `#gitlens.heatmap.coldColor#` instead of `#gitlens.heatmap.hotColor#`)

gitlens.heatmap.coldColor.description: Specifies the base color of the gutter heatmap annotations when the most recent change is older (cold) than the `#gitlens.heatmap.ageThreshold#` value

gitlens.heatmap.hotColor.description: Specifies the base color of the gutter heatmap annotations when the most recent change is newer (hot) than the `#gitlens.heatmap.ageThreshold#` value

enumDescriptions: Toggles each file individually
Toggles the window, i.e. all files at once
gitlens.heatmap.toggleMode.description: Specifies how the gutter heatmap annotations will be toggled

gitlens.hovers.annotations.changes.description: Specifies whether to provide a changes (diff) hover for all lines when showing blame annotations

gitlens.hovers.annotations.details.description: Specifies whether to provide a commit details hover for all lines when showing blame annotations

gitlens.hovers.annotations.enabled.description: Specifies whether to provide any hovers when showing blame annotations

enumDescriptions: Only shown when hovering over the line annotation
Shown when hovering anywhere over the line
gitlens.hovers.annotations.over.description: Specifies when to trigger hovers when showing blame annotations

gitlens.hovers.currentLine.changes.description: Specifies whether to provide a changes (diff) hover for the current line

gitlens.hovers.currentLine.details.description: Specifies whether to provide a commit details hover for the current line

gitlens.hovers.currentLine.enabled.description: Specifies whether to provide any hovers for the current line

enumDescriptions: Only shown when hovering over the line annotation
Shown when hovering anywhere over the line
gitlens.hovers.currentLine.over.description: Specifies when to trigger hovers for the current line

gitlens.hovers.avatars.description: Specifies whether to show avatar images in hovers

gitlens.hovers.enabled.description: Specifies whether to provide any hovers

gitlens.insiders.description: Specifies whether to enable experimental features

enumDescriptions: Adds an alternate set of shortcut keys that start with `Alt` (⌥ on macOS)
Adds a chorded set of shortcut keys that start with `Ctrl+Alt+G` (`⌥⌘G` on macOS)
No shortcut keys will be added
gitlens.keymap.description: Specifies the keymap to use for GitLens shortcut keys

gitlens.menus.description: Specifies which commands will be added to which menus

gitlens.mode.active.description: Specifies the active GitLens mode, if any

gitlens.mode.statusBar.enabled.description: Specifies whether to provide the active GitLens mode in the status bar

enumDescriptions: Aligns to the left
Aligns to the right
gitlens.mode.statusBar.alignment.description: Specifies the active GitLens mode alignment in the status bar

zen.name: Zen
zen.description: for a zen-like experience, disables many visual features

review.name: Review
review.description: for reviewing code, enables many visual features

gitlens.outputLevel.description: Specifies how much (if any) output will be sent to the GitLens output channel

enumDescriptions: Adds a gutter glyph
Adds a full-line highlight background color
Adds a decoration to the overview ruler (scroll bar)

gitlens.recentChanges.highlight.location.description: Specifies where the highlights of the recently changed lines will be shown

enumDescriptions: Toggles each file individually
Toggles the window, i.e. all files at once
gitlens.recentChanges.toggleMode.description: Specifies how the recently changed lines annotations will be toggled

type.description: Specifies the type of the custom remote service

domain.description: Specifies the domain name of the custom remote service

name.description: Specifies an optional friendly name for the custom remote service

protocol.description: Specifies an optional url protocol for the custom remote service

repository.description:
Specifies the format of a respository url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${repo} - repository path

branches.description:
Specifies the format of a branches url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${repo} - repository path
 ${branch} - branch

branch.description:
Specifies the format of a branch url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${repo} - repository path
 ${branch} - branch

commit.description:
Specifies the format of a commit url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${repo} - repository path
 ${id} - commit id

file.description:
Specifies the format of a file url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${repo} - repository path
 ${file} - file name
 ${line} - formatted line information

fileInBranch.description:
Specifies the format of a branch file url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${repo} - repository path
 ${file} - file name
 ${branch} - branch
 ${line} - formatted line information

fileInCommit.description:
Specifies the format of a commit file url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${repo} - repository path
 ${file} - file name
 ${id} - commit id
 ${line} - formatted line information

fileLine.description:
Specifies the format of a line in a file url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${line} - line

fileRange.description:
Specifies the format of a range in a file url for the custom remote service
Available tokens
 ${start} - starting line
 ${end} - ending line

properties.description: Specifies the url formats of the custom remote service

gitlens.remotes.description: Specifies user-defined remote (code-hosting) services or custom domains for built-in remote services

enumDescriptions: Only displays common settings
Displays all settings
gitlens.settings.mode.description: Specifies the display mode of the interactive settings editor

gitlens.showWhatsNewAfterUpgrades.description: Specifies whether to show What's New after upgrading to new feature releases

enumDescriptions: Aligns to the left
Aligns to the right
gitlens.statusBar.alignment.description: Specifies the blame alignment in the status bar

enumDescriptions: Toggles file blame annotations
Compares the current line commit with the previous
Compares the current line commit with the working tree
Toggles Git code lens
Shows a commit details quick pick
Shows a commit file details quick pick
Shows a file history quick pick
Shows a branch history quick pick
gitlens.statusBar.command.description: Specifies the command to be executed when the blame status bar item is clicked

gitlens.statusBar.dateFormat.description: Specifies the date format of absolute dates shown in the blame information in the status bar. See https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/ for valid formats

gitlens.statusBar.enabled.description: Specifies whether to provide blame information in the status bar

gitlens.statusBar.format.description:
Specifies the format of the status bar blame information
Available tokens
 ${id} - commit id
 ${author} - commit author
 ${message} - commit message
 ${ago} - relative commit date (e.g. 1 day ago)
 ${date} - formatted commit date (format specified by `gitlens.statusBar.dateFormat`)
 ${agoOrDate} - commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
 ${authorAgo} - commit author, relative commit date
 ${authorAgoOrDate} - commit author, commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
See https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/wiki/Advanced-Formatting for advanced formatting

gitlens.statusBar.reduceFlicker.description: Specifies whether to avoid clearing the previous blame information when changing lines to reduce status bar "flashing"

gitlens.strings.codeLens.unsavedChanges..default: Unsaved changes (cannot determine recent change or authors)
gitlens.strings.codeLens.unsavedChanges..description: Specifies the string to be shown in place of both the `recent change` and `authors` code lens when there are unsaved changes
Specifies the string to be shown in place of the `recent change` code lens when there are unsaved changes
Specifies the string to be shown in place of the `authors` code lens when there are unsaved changes

gitlens.views.avatars.description: Specifies whether to show avatar images instead of commit (or status) icons in the `Repositories` and `Results` views

gitlens.views.commitFileFormat.description:
Specifies the format of a committed file in the `Repositories` and `Results` views
Available tokens
 ${directory} - directory name
 ${file} - file name
 ${filePath} - formatted file name and path
 ${path} - full file path

gitlens.views.commitFormat.description:
Specifies the format of committed changes in the `Repositories` and `Results` views
Available tokens
 ${id} - commit id
 ${author} - commit author
 ${message} - commit message
 ${ago} - relative commit date (e.g. 1 day ago)
 ${date} - formatted commit date (format specified by `gitlens.defaultDateFormat`)\n ${agoOrDate} - commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
 ${authorAgo} - commit author, relative commit date
 ${authorAgoOrDate} - commit author, commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
See https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/wiki/Advanced-Formatting for advanced formatting

gitlens.views.defaultItemLimit.description: Specifies the default number of items to show in a view list. Use 0 to specify no limit

gitlens.views.fileHistory.avatars.description: Specifies whether to show avatar images instead of status icons in the `File History` view

gitlens.views.fileHistory.enabled.description: Specifies whether to show the `File History` view

enumDescriptions: Adds to the GitLens view
Adds to the Explorer view
Adds to the Source Control view
gitlens.views.fileHistory.location.description: Specifies where to show the `File History` view

gitlens.views.lineHistory.avatars.description: Specifies whether to show avatar images instead of status icons in the `Line History` view

gitlens.views.lineHistory.enabled.description: Specifies whether to show the `Line History` view

enumDescriptions: Adds to the GitLens view
Adds to the Explorer view
Adds to the Source Control view
gitlens.views.lineHistory.location.description: Specifies where to show the `Line History` view

gitlens.views.repositories.autoRefresh.description: Specifies whether to automatically refresh the `Repositories` view when the repository or the file system changes

gitlens.views.repositories.autoReveal.description: Specifies whether to automatically reveal repositories in the `Repositories` view when opening files

enumDescriptions: Displays branches as a list
Displays branches as a tree when branch names contain slashes `/`
gitlens.views.repositories.branches.layo.description: Specifies how the `Repositories` view will display branches

gitlens.views.repositories.enabled.description: Specifies whether to show the `Repositories` view

gitlens.views.repositories.files.compact.description:
Specifies whether to compact (flatten) unnecessary file nesting in the `Repositories` view
Only applies when `#gitlens.views.repositories.files.layout#` is set to `tree` or `auto`

enumDescriptions: Automatically switches between displaying files as a `tree` or `list` based on the `#gitlens.views.repositories.files.threshold#` value and the number of files at each nesting level
Displays files as a list
Displays files as a tree
gitlens.views.repositories.files.layout.description: Specifies how the `Repositories` view will display files

gitlens.views.repositories.files.thresho.description:
Specifies when to switch between displaying files as a `tree` or `list` based on the number of files in a nesting level in the `Repositories` view
Only applies when `#gitlens.views.repositories.files.layout#` is set to `auto`

gitlens.views.repositories.includeWorkin.description: Specifies whether to include working tree files inside the `Repository Status` node of the `Repositories` view

enumDescriptions: Adds to the GitLens view
Adds to the Explorer view
Adds to the Source Control view
gitlens.views.repositories.location.description: Specifies where to show the `Repositories` view

gitlens.views.repositories.showTrackingB.description: Specifies whether to show the tracking branch when displaying local branches in the `Repositories` view

gitlens.views.results.files.compact.description:
Specifies whether to compact (flatten) unnecessary file nesting in the `Results` view
Only applies when `#gitlens.views.results.files.layout#` is set to `tree` or `auto`

enumDescriptions: Automatically switches between displaying files as a `tree` or `list` based on the `#gitlens.views.repositories.files.threshold#` value and the number of files at each nesting level
Displays files as a list
Displays files as a tree
gitlens.views.results.files.layout.description: Specifies how the `Results` view will display files

gitlens.views.results.files.threshold.description:
Specifies when to switch between displaying files as a `tree` or `list` based on the number of files in a nesting level in the `Results` view
Only applies when `#gitlens.views.results.files.layout#` is set to `auto`

enumDescriptions: Adds to the GitLens view
Adds to the Explorer view
Adds to the Source Control view
gitlens.views.results.location.description: Specifies where to show the `Results` view

gitlens.views.stashFileFormat.description:
Specifies the format of a stashed file in the `Repositories` and `Results` views
Available tokens
 ${directory} - directory name
 ${file} - file name
 ${filePath} - formatted file name and path
 ${path} - full file path

gitlens.views.stashFormat.description:
Specifies the format of stashed changes in the `Repositories` and `Results` views
Available tokens
 ${id} - commit id
 ${author} - commit author
 ${message} - commit message
 ${ago} - relative commit date (e.g. 1 day ago)
 ${date} - formatted commit date (format specified by `gitlens.statusBar.dateFormat`)
 ${agoOrDate} - commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
 ${authorAgo} - commit author, relative commit date
 ${authorAgoOrDate} - commit author, commit date specified by `gitlens.defaultDateStyle`
See https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/wiki/Advanced-Formatting for advanced formatting

gitlens.views.statusFileFormat.description:
Specifies the format of the status of a working or committed file in the `Repositories` view
Available tokens
 ${directory} - directory name
 ${file} - file name
 ${filePath} - formatted file name and path
 ${path} - full file path
 ${working} - optional indicator if the file is uncommitted

gitlens.advanced.blame.customArguments.description: Specifies additional arguments to pass to the `git blame` command

gitlens.advanced.blame.delayAfterEdit.description: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) to wait before re-blaming an unsaved document after an edit. Use 0 to specify an infinite wait

gitlens.advanced.blame.sizeThresholdAfte.description: Specifies the maximum document size (in lines) allowed to be re-blamed after an edit while still unsaved. Use 0 to specify no maximum

gitlens.advanced.caching.enabled.description: Specifies whether git output will be cached — changing the default is not recommended

gitlens.advanced.fileHistoryFollowsRenam.description: Specifies whether file histories will follow renames — will affect how merge commits are shown in histories

gitlens.advanced.maxListItems.description: Specifies the maximum number of items to show in a list. Use 0 to specify no maximum

gitlens.advanced.messages.description: Specifies which messages should be suppressed

gitlens.advanced.quickPick.closeOnFocusO.description: Specifies whether to close QuickPick menus when focus is lost

gitlens.advanced.repositorySearchDepth.description: Specifies how many folders deep to search for repositories

gitlens.advanced.telemetry.enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable GitLens telemetry (even if enabled still abides by the overall `telemetry.enableTelemetry` setting

colors.description: Specifies the background color of the gutter blame annotations
Specifies the foreground color of the gutter blame annotations
Specifies the foreground color of an uncommitted line in the gutter blame annotations
Specifies the background color of the blame annotation for the current line
Specifies the foreground color of the blame annotation for the current line
Specifies the background color of the associated line highlights in blame annotations
Specifies the overview ruler color of the associated line highlights in blame annotations

commands.title: Compare HEAD with Branch or Tag...
Compare Working Tree with Branch or Tag...
Open Changes with Branch or Tag...
Open Line Changes with Previous Revision
Open Line Changes with Working File
Copy Remote File Url to Clipboard
Open Directory Compare with Working Tree
Open All Changes with Working Tree

scripts.pretty: prettier --config .prettierrc --loglevel warn --write "./**/*.{ts,md,json}" && tslint --project tsconfig.json --fix && tslint --project ui.tsconfig.json --fix
scripts.rebuild: npm run reset && npm run build
scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run reset && npm run bundle
